radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild bibasilar atelectasis, no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. The appendix is fluid-filled and dilated up to 12 mm with wall thickening and hyperenhancement, moderate surrounding mesenteric fat stranding. No evidence of macro perforation. No drainable fluid collection. No bowel obstruction. Tiny hypodensities in the kidneys most likely cysts. Normal findings for the liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenals, stomach, small bowel, colon, and rectum.
